Thats pretty cool tbh. If you where to erase the semi-transparent lines that are below the guitar it would look a bit better. Makes your guitar looks powerful ;\

Anyways… Why did you add a black/white gradient map, then try and erase it over your person? Why not just leave it all black/white or just don’t put a gradient map at all?

item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Well you got the basics down, but after you have the first lines, when you copy that onto the new image, do what you want to it but then press ctrl+i to invert it. That gives much more detail.

item.title: <insert eye catching title here>
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Gradient maps? Soft light? Never used those in the making tbh. Hue/saturation and maybe a photofilter. I think I used a color balance layer but I’m not sure. Originally I made 3 thick lines(about 13px) and then I made 5px lines circling them all(about 2-3 on each). Keep in mind I made all of these lines white, and on a separate layer from the Black background.
I then put all these line layers together and copied it, and Distorted it with one of those filters. I then made a copy of the original again and used the liquefy tool to add most of the effects you see there. I then inverted the colors of the background and the lower layer(this is the one I used liquefy on[It covered the most space]) and the top layer which was distorted. Which added a nice effect that I liked. I started changing colors and such. Then new layer>apply image and did a Gaussian blur at 3px. Setting the layer to lighten. Tada.

[quote=“fellixombc, post:23, topic:139462”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=191448.msg1727523#msg1727523 date=1188794527]

The thing is, I have never used the pen tool effectively. Sometimes I accidentially click it and it fucks up my image.

But I’ve never really tried it.
I wouldn’t know how to make the lines thicker, or color them, or anything.

The pen tool and spline tool are very similar…

To make it thicker, when your done with the line, get a… lets say 90 pixel brush? and then right click stroke.

Color, Gradients Photo filters… lots of other stuff that I don’t feel like naming

dosent look like he used the pen tool tbh
[/quote]You must be blind tbh.

no im not blind, i just though you didnt have alot of time to do a 10 hour project tbh

Or you just don’t know how to do it tbh…

i know how to do it, pen tool, and some gradient mapes, soft light, etc, i would just be to lazy[/quote]tbh, your talking straight out of your ass. You haven’t the slightest idea of what your talking about, this isn’t even hard. Me, being as lazy as I am, and having ADD/ADHD - even I could make it.

Read full topic
